97060411-d-06-27-97-SOO.Narrative: CREW ON TURN 57 WERE TAXIED TO CRANE, IN TO COMBINE TRAINS 241-25 AND 241-26 AND BRING TRAIN TO SPRING HILL FOR DEPARTURE.  FIRST MOVE WAS TO GET THE FOUR ENGINE AND 21 CARS ON CRANE 2 TRACK TO PULL NORTHWARD TOWARD NORTH SIDING SWITCH, CUT POWER OFF AND GO TOWARD SIDING WHERE TWO ENGINE AND NINE CARS WERE.  THEY PICKED UP TRAIN, DOUBLED TO THE 21 CARS  ON MAIN AND SHOVED BACK TO 44 CARS  ON THE MAIN.   CONDUCTOR ADVISED HE HAD A MARKER LIGHT AND TOLD ENGINEER TO BACK UP SO HE COULD PUT MARKER ON ENGINE.  ENGINEER WAS ADVISED  CARS WOULD FIT TRACK.  AFTER MARKER WAS PLACED ON ENGINE, THEY PULLED FORWARD AND TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  CREW DISCOVERED THAT THEY HAD SHOVED THROUGH THE SOUTH SIDING SWITCH THAT WAS LINED FOR THE SIDING AND HAD DERAILED.  AT TIME OF DERAILMENT, CREW WAS NOT AWARE THAT 241-26, WHO WAS SHORT ON TIME, WAS ALLOWED BY TRACK WARRANT TO LEAVE THE SOUTH SIDING SWITCHAT CRANE LINED FOR THE SIDING, TRACK WARRANT AUTHORITY WERE FOR NORTHWARD MOVEMENTS FROM THE SOUTHSIDING SWITCH AND DID NOT SHOW IT IMPROPERLY LINED.  CONDUCTOR ACCEPTED FULL RESPONSIBILITY AND SIGNED A WAIVER IN LIEU OF INVESTIGATION AND WAS ASSESSED FIVE DAYS ACTUAL SUSPENSION.  TESTING WAS PERFORMED UNDER COMPANY POLICY.NoneNone

IN ADDITION, TRACK 12 AND 13 WEST RECEIVING YARD SUSTAINED DAMAGE AND INSIDE SWITCH FOR 12 AND 13 TORN OUT ALONG WITHYARD AIR PUMP. ON TRACK 15,  NORTH OF BRC TRACK 14 IN WEST RECEIVING YARD WEREEMPTY COAL HOPPERS IN POSSESSION OF THE BRC.  THREE  BRC WEST CARS  SUSTAINED DAMAGE AS A RESULT OFBEING SIDESWIPED BY THE DERAILED CARS OF SOO TRAIN.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES AS A RESULT OF THE MISHAP.NoneNoneNone

97060396-d-06-11-97-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 219 ON APPROACH TO GALEWOOD WAS LINED INTO NO. 3 RECEIVING.  TRAIN CONSISTED OF 30 LOADS, 28 EMPTIES, 3319 TONS, 3225 FEET, WITH TWO DEAD ENGINES IN TOW BEHIND WORKING ENGINE SOO 761.  AS TRAINENTERED NO. 3 RECEIVING, ENGINEER FELT TUG ON TRAIN, LOOKED OVER SHOULDER, SAW DUST, SUSPECTED DERAILMENT, THREW TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY.  TRAIN TRAVELED ABOUT 350 FEET FROM P.O.D TO STOP.  ONE DEAD ENGINE IN TOW AND NEXT FOUR CARS BEHIND WORKING UNIT HAD DERAILED AS THEY ENCOUNTERED A BROKEN RAIL.  SOUTH SIDE INDUSTRY JOB 1502 RESCUED REAR OF TRAIN OFF NO. 3 MAIN, PULLED WEST AND SHOVED TRAIN ONTO NO. 1 RECEIVING FOR 219 TO GRAB.  TRAIN 219 CREW INTERVIEWED BY YARD MANAGER AND WORK PROJECT COORDINATOR WITH NO EXCEPTIONS TAKEN.  DEAD UNITS IN TOW VERIFIED AS HAVING ALIGNMENT COUPLERS.  OPERATIONSCOORDINATOR ARRANGED FOR DOWNLOAD OF SPEED RECORDER INFORMATION FROM SOO 761 AT PORTAGE, ACCOMPLISHED BY ROAD FOREMAN WITH NO EXCEPTIONS TAKEN TO TRAIN HANDLING.  HULCHER SUMMONED ON ARRIVAL AT GALEWOOD TO RERAIL EQUIPMENT.  SITE INVESTIGATED BY ROADMASTER, YARD MANAGER, WORK PROJECT COORDINATOR,AND MECHANICAL OFFICERS, CAUSE DETERMINED AS BROKEN RAIL.  CREW RELEASED TO CONTINUE TRIP TO PORTAGE, WISCONSIN.NoneNone

97055-d-06-05-97-ARR.Narrative: THE 7002 NORTH WAS PULLING OUT OF A GRAVEL PIT LOOP TRACK AFTER LOADING.  THE 4259 FOOT TRAIN WITH LOADED HOPPER CARS WAS BEING PULLED OUT OF THE INDUSTRY LOOP NORTH ONTO THE PALMER BRANCH.  APPROXIMATELY TWO-THIRDS OF THE TRAIN TRAVERSED THE SWITCH ONTO THE PALMER BRANCH WHEN THE OUTSIDE RAIL ON THE CURVE JUST NORTH OF THE SWITCH ON THE INDUSTRY TRACK, ROLLED OVER RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT OF EIGHT (8) RAIL CARS.  INSPECTION OF THE DERAILMENT REVEALED THE TRACK STRUCTURE WAS BURIED IN SAND AND GRAVEL.  THE TIES ON THE LOW RAIL WERE DIFFERENTIALLY PLATE CUT APPROXIMATELY ONE-HALF INCH.  THELOW RAIL SHOWED UNUSUAL WEAR ON THE GAGE CORNER.  THE HIGH RAIL WAS MODERATELY CURVE WORN.  THE TRACK STRUCTURE IS MAINTAINED BY THE GRAVEL INDUSTRY.  THE LAST ARRC INSPECTION WAS ON 06/03/97.  NONE AT THE ABOVE DEFECTS WAS NOTED.  THE INVESTIGATION LED TO THE ELIMINATION OF MECHANICAL AND TRAIN HANDLING AS CAUSAL FACTORS FOR THIS DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
